medium: Colors and gold on sized cotton
title: Shakyamuni Buddha, The Enlightened One
description: A thanka, pigments on fabric, wood; symmetrically arranged deities in the upper register; donor figures represented at the bottom in native dress; figures are engaged in various consecration ceremonies; the mount of this thanka is painted with designs imitating the imperial Chinese brocade typically used to frame thankas belonging to important monasteries
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund and Gift of funds from Ingrid Lenz and Alfred Harrison, and Donna and Cargill MacMillan Jr.
